1131111221.content:
As the second trial came to a close, the students filed out of the execution room, except for Ishimaru who remained on the ground crying out in agony. Most of the students headed towards their rooms, hardly looking into each others' eyes, lest they remember how one of their own had once again committed murder. As Yasuhiro Hagakure walked away, he heard his stomach rumble. He realized that with all the investigating going on throughout the day he had forgotten to eat his second lunch. Yes, his second lunch.

Since arriving at the school Hagakure had more access to food than he did most days, since he spent all his savings on "supernatural" trinkets. All this new food was beyond tempting to the "student," and he had gone out of his way to gorge as much as possible. Sadly, by the time he came to the cafeteria he remembered the rule about the room being closed at night. As if he believed his prayers would be answered, Hagakure groaned out loud "Monokuma... please just open the door... I'm staaaarviiiiing, man!" As if on queue the bear popped out.

"Well if you're gonna whine like that I might as well give you an answer. Nope!" Monokuma posed as if he was smirking.

"Pleeeeaaaase, man! Think of it this way! No way I can commit murder on an empty stomach! That doesn't mean I will, but really!" Monokuma's head turned.

"Well when you put it that way..." Monokuma bounces around a corner. Hagakure followed after him in pursuit.

"Hey, come back you little..." When the young adult turned the corner he saw that there was no trace of the bear to be found. Instead, he heard the creak of the door to the cafeteria behind him. Monokuma strolled out clad in an apron and chef's hat, holding a platter of steaming burgers and fries. The smell called for Hagakure like a siren's song.

"Here's your extra snack, fatso. Chef sends his regards." Monokuma handed the platter to Hagakure and returned into the cafeteria. Hagakure heard the click of the door closing and locking behind him.

"Fatso, huh..." the boy pondered. He shook off the comment and went into his room to stuff himself. Each bite into the juicy burgers was beyond perfection. They were laden with grease, but it didn't matter to the hungry boy who within minutes had cleared almost all of the stack of food big enough to feed several. As he neared the end of his feast Hagakure felt his belt tightening. He looked down and saw his swollen belly straining against it. He undid his belt and tossed it to the floor, and his gut surged out, forcing a sigh of relief out of him. With renewed vigor, Hagakure downed the last of the burgers.

Now thoroughly stuffed, Hagakure tossed the tray next to the belt and laid down on his bed. Looking up, he saw his belly rise above him, perhaps more than it ever had before. The student massaged his gut with greasy fingers, moaning softly from the relief of pressure. To his surprise, he found that his fingers sunk into a soft layer of chub that had formed around him. He examined it, finding that the flab wrapped around his sides as well. "Well, I guess this is what happens when you get enough to eat" Hagakure thought to himself. "It's no biggie. It will be gone tomorrow, and if not, who cares..." And on that note, Hagakure changed into his (tighter than before) pyjamas and went to bed.

The next day he woke up, as usual, hungry. Hagakure was quick to dress and make his way to the cafeteria. On the way there, he noticed his belly hadn't gotten much smaller and his belt was still a little tight, but that wasn't important. What was important was finding some food to get in his stomach before he passes out from malnourishment! Pushing open the doors with haste, Hagakure found that the only person in the room was Naegi, quietly eating a bowl of cereal. Hagakure grabbed a few sandwiches and a slice of pizza and sat down next to the boy, who looked at him nervously.

"Yo, Naegi-kun! What's up?" Hagakure wrapped an arm around the boy, who blushed lightly and eyed the size of his plate.

"Not much... I'm just a little stressed after last night... but it can't be as bad as what Ishimaru-kun is going through." Naegi sighed.

"Come on, man. You're one of the few guys around here who thinks positive! Can't let you lose your head now, right?" Hagakure said with concern, or at least that's what he meant. Understanding him wasn't easy when half a sandwich was in his mouth.

"Um.. thanks, Hagakure-kun..." Naegi's eyes stayed low, as if he was fixated on something. In fact, he was. The strain of Hagakure's belly against his belt was... interesting. Naegi couldn't describe it, but it was indeed interesting. He felt compelled to stare longer, but forced himself to look away. Naegi wondered what Hagakure's belly was like. It was clear he was getting one... then an idea rose in his head. "You know, you're right! We should go to the sauna after breakfast and unwind."

"That sounds sweet, man! Just don't count on going too soon, I'm about to go back for seconds. I haven't eaten since last night!" Hagakure left Naegi sitting in his seat, awkwardly trying to cover up an arousal that he did not understand. Why was Hagakure's paunch so... captivating?!?

11311112211.content:
A few hours and maybe an extra small meal or two later Hagakure made his way to the sauna. It was a little solemn because of it's connection to the last murder, but the tall boy's mind was a little too dim to fully process that. Bag of goodies in hand (just in case), Hagakure entered the sauna clad in a towel, leaving his upper body exposed. Naegi was inside waiting.

"Yo Naegi-kun! I'm here!" Hagakure waved at Naegi who gestured for him to sit down. As Hagakure sat, his belly folded into small rolls.

"Oh wow," Naegi thought as a shade of pink rose to his cheeks. "Did he actually get bigger from this morning?" As if to answer his question Hagakure's belly rumbled.

"Sorry, man. This thing won't shut up today! Good thing the cafeteria's loaded!" He reached into a bad and pulled out a cookie to munch on. Naegi's face darkened further.

"A-are you s-sure that's allowed?" Naegi stammered, pressing down on the towel covering his privates.

"Yeah, I asked the bear. It seems to be fine with me eating anywhere lately. As much as I want too! Good to know it's got at least part of a heart, or at least knows what it's like to have a stomach." He patted his belly and it jiggled a little.

"Y-yeah..." So the two sat there and relaxed quietly as Hagakure munched on a cookie or two out of his (rather full) bag of snacks....
11311112211.title: At the sauna...

113111122111.content:
For a good five minute period, Naegi bore witness to a miracle. Hagakure stopped eating. Honestly it seemed less a miracle to him and more a punishment from on high for the lust he was feeling about it. Regardless, Naegi was surprised that he had gone so long without feeding his soft gut, which by now stuck out a good few inches in front of him. Naegi observed Hagakure's tan body, noting that his chest had gotten puffier too. He didn't have "moobs" but he wasn't too far off. His butt looked wider too. Naegi wondered what it looked like under the towel... He let his mind wonder until it was interrupted by a sound that he swore was going to be the death of him if nothing else in this school.

*GRRRRRR* Hagakure let out a complaining whine. "Damn, I'm still hungry? I don't wanna moooove....." He was thoroughly relaxed in his position and did not want to move a muscle. Naegi, as guilty as he felt, wanted to see him feed himself again. Watching this bloated boy, older than he was, stuff himself so greedily was by now a full turn on and Naegi could not avoid it no matter how his mind put it.

"You're not gonna move just to eat? Are you that lazy?" He said, hoping he could motivate the other to continue snacking.

"Yep... too lazy..." As if in agreement with Naegi, Hagakure's stomach growled again. "Shut uuuuup! I'm not feeding you..." He said out loud to his belly. Naegi heard hope dying in every word of that phrase, and he would not stand for it. He would make his own hope! He grabbed the bag for himself.

"Well if you won't feed it maybe I should then!" He said teasingly, holding a buttery cookie up to Hagakure's lips. He smiled and nibbled on the end. Naegi took this as a queue to gently shove it into his mouth, giving him time to chew and swallow before presenting the next cookie. In between cookies Hagakure spoke to him.

"Thanks Naegi-kun.... *chew chew* ...you're a real pal, you know that? *chew chew chew* I mean, someone's gotta support my vices! *chew*"

"I wouldn't call it a vice. It's just food, right?" Naegi patted Hagakure's belly and for the first time felt how soft it was. The way it jiggled under his touch was heavenly. Naegi rested his hand on the belly and began rubbing gently in circles, pressing the fat between his fingers.

"Yo Naegi-kun, what are ya doing there?" Hagakure asked, more in a friendly way than anything else.

"I just figured, if you're eating so much you must be pretty stuffed. This helps right? I heard it does." Naegi put that forward as his excuse and Hagakure bought it.

"Oh, thanks man. But if you're gonna do that let's head to my room. Don't want anyone getting any wrong ideas!" His smile was innocent, but the blush on his face alluded to something more. But maybe it was just the heat. They were in a sauna after all.

1131111221111.content:
The two boys stepped out of the sauna and put back on their clothes before heading back to Hagakure's room. Naegi had never been in the room before. There were some scrolls on the wall and a table with a purple cloth covering it, upon which sat some cards with obscure, melodramatic drawings. As Naegi closed the door behind him, his foot brushed against something on the ground. He looked down to find a half-eaten burger just lying there.

"Sweet! I was wondering where that baby went!" Hagakure scooped it up off the ground and shoved it down his gullet.

"Uh, Hagakure-kun, do you know how long that was on the ground for?" Naegi scratched his head, a little grossed out despite enjoying Hagakure's continued gluttony.

"Nope. Noooooooow..." Hagakure strolled over to a closet door and opened it up. The closet was practically stuffed to the brim with burgers, pizza, buckets of fries, sandwiches, bowls of pasta, cookies, cakes and everything else the cafeteria served.

"Holy f-" Naegi cut himself off. "Hagakure-kun, why is there so much food in your closet!"

"What can I say? I kept waking up in the middle of the night with hunger pangs so I smuggled a few snacks in here to help with the cravings. Don't worry, I've got a microwave in here too. You're welcome to use it, dude! Just don't tell anyone. Ishimaru-kun'll probs find some way to call it a hazard." Hagakure popped a slice of pizza in the microwave and grabbed another bag of cookies. He sat down on his bed and reclined, letting his paunch rise into the air as he tossed the snacks into his mouth.

"This may be... a little overboard." Naegi said as he approached Hagakure. "Don't you think it's a little abnormal for you to eat so much?"

"Who cares? It's great!" Hagakure mumbled through a stuffed mouth. He swallowed and reiterated. "It's fine. The bear doesn't care and it helps deal with the stress, ya know?"

"Even so, this is just-" Naegi was about to bring up just how strange Hagakure's eating habits were, but he was cut off as a cookie was shoved in his mouth.

"Oh, don't be a bummer, man! You need to eat more, ya know? You're skinny as hell!"

Naegi chewed the cookie and swallowed it, smiling and going along with it. "Or maybe you're just getting fat!" He poked at Hagakure's pudge.

"Fat? You really think so?" Hagakure lifted up is shirt and played with his belly, jiggling it and poking it. Naegi felt his face heat up again. Hagakure shrugged. "Eh, I guess so. Whatever." He went back to munching.

"Whatever? You aren't concerned?"

"Nah, man. There are worse things in the world. 'Sides, the extra weight might help with my image. A big gut would make me look all mystical and stuff, you know?" Hagakure patted his belly.

"Oh..." Naegi sat down and stared at the older boy's belly. The microwave buzzed. "Well, if that's how you feel..." He got up and retrieved the slice of pizza from the microwave in the closet. "Then I guess you should eat up!" He held the slice of pizza over Hagakure's head as he lied down on his bed. Hagakure grinned and opened in mouth up wide as Naegi lowered the pizza bite by bite into his mouth.

"Thanks Naegs. You're a true bro, ya know that?"

Naegi laughed, his face still blushing. "Thanks, Hagakure-kun. If you ever need help with that, I guess I can do that!"

Hagakure's eyes flashed as he grinned. "That's a great idea, dude! You can be my personal feeder! You can follow me around and feed me stuff whenever I'm hungry. I get food, maybe a nice mystical belly, and you get to spend time with yours truly!"

Naegi couldn't believe what he was hearing. "That kind of sounds like being your slave!" He said with hesitation, but then thought about the idea. "...but I'll do it. You're my friend, Hagakure-kun!" He rested his hand on Hagakure's belly. "I'll do my best to feed you as much as I can!" As strange as the situation was, Naegi could feel a strong bond forming between Hagakure and himself.

114131.content:
Lunchtime at Kibogamine Academy. All the Super High School Level students gathered in the cafeteria, outside, in various classrooms or wherever their talent called them to eat lunch. One such student, Mondo Oowada, the SHSL Biker Gang Leader, leaned against the wall and waited outside the doors to the cafeteria. He was was waiting for his brother, Kiyotaka Ishimaru, or Taka to his friends. Well, they weren't brothers, and in many ways they didn't even resemble each other, but they were as close as two friends could be. Kiyotaka was off doing his quick rounds, checking the halls for delinquency, before heading off to the cafeteria to eat his own lunch. Meanwhile, Mondo was perfectly positioned to throw some intimidating glances at the punier students, who may at times happen to "give" him their lunch money to "ensure their safety." Kiyotaka of course was not aware, but what he didn't know wouldn't hurt him.

It had been a pretty good day for Mondo. He had gym class, which was always a breeze for him so long as he didn't give any kids a concussion in dodgeball. Art class he managed to skip... again... and math class he had with his bro so he was at least able to get some help understanding why an X is also a number. He even managed to get a full five dollars out of that pink haired mechanic! Of course, watching the kid's reaction to Mondo glowering at him was worth at least twice that.

Indeed, today had been a fruitful day, or at least it had been until he saw Kiyotaka sulk his way, bagged lunch in hand. Mondo shrugged it off, assuming it had been a rough round of monitoring and he usually didn't want to hear about his fellow delinquents and his bro butting heads again. The two walked off to a table that held their places. They were joined by some of their other classmates, Makoto Naegi and Hifumi Yamada being two of them. Naegi, being the nice guy he was, noticed right off the bat that something was troubling Kiyotaka. "Hey Taka, what's wrong? Hard day of monitoring?" He asked in his genuine way. Mondo winced, knowing better than to ask.

To Mondo's surprise, Kiyotaka just sighed. "No, it's nothing. I would not trouble you with my meager problems." Naegi shrugged and continued nibbling on his sandwich as Ishimaru unpacked his own. Mondo knew this meant trouble. If his bro wasn't willing to talk about it then it was probably weighing heavily on him. Despite his concern, Mondo eyed Kiyotaka's lunch to see if there was anything to mooch on. Of course there wasn't much. Just a sandwich, a granola bar and a bottle of water. Mondo on the other hand had protein, protein, protein. Sakura had given him tips on the right ones to choose to maximize muscle health and growth.

Kiyotaka tore a bite out of his sandwich angrily and chewed with spite. Mondo felt uncomfortable sitting next to him when he was like this. His bro wouldn't be consolable until they could be alone, but this angry eating had been going on for a few weeks and Mondo was not naturally patient. "Uh, hey bro... something wrong with that sandwich? You look like you want it deader than it is."

"Of course it's trash!" Yamada chimed in. "It looks dry and flavorless and it lacks color!"

Mondo snatched a Pocky stick out of the doujin writer's hand and smacked him on the head with it. "Yeah and I'm sure your pizza slice and cheeseburger are so much healthier, fat ass! At least bro doesn't weigh more than... uh... something fat!"

Kiyotaka winced and put a hand on Oowada's shoulder. "Brother, please. You should not point out people's flaws..." He sat up, having finished his meager meal. "If you'll excuse me, I have to go." He hurried off. Mondo followed, but not before splashing Yamada's soda in his face.

"Bro, wait up!" Mondo yelled as he chased after his friend. Kiyotaka increased his pace, walking swiftly in the other direction, head down in shame. Mondo, who was not concerned with running in the halls, caught up to him and grabbed him. Kiyotaka turned around. Tears were streaming down his face. "Bro..." Mondo was not surprised. It was not the first time his bro cried in the halls. Mondo pulled Kiyotaka into a hug, letting the shorter boy sob into his shirt. After a few minutes nobody had passed and Kiyotaka's erratic sobs slowed into heavy breathing. Mondo wrapped an arm around him and the two started walking outside. "Come on, bro. Now you're gonna tell me what's wrong and I'll punch it in the nuts."

Kiyotaka laughed softly. "I would suggest against punching my family history in it's genitalia, metaphorical or physical."

Mondo sat them down under a shady tree away from the other students. "Family history? Is this about your grandpa? Cuz I thought you weren't gonna let that get you down."

"Well, I suppose it does have to do with him... Brother, I don't believe you've ever seen my father. Have you seen a picture of my grandfather?" Kiyotaka said. "What do you remember him being like?"

"Uh, well you told me he was a genius and he let that get the best of him and-" Mondo started but Kiyotaka cut him off.

"No, what did he LOOK like."

"Black hair... red eyes... I guess he was on the bigger side."

"Precisely." Kiyotaka gave a nod. "My grandfather was a big man. In fact he was very big during his time. As was his father, and his father before him, and so on. And so is my father. For generations the Ishimaru family has consisted of big men with large, round, powerful stomachs. It is believed we are descended from a line of champion sumo wrestlers from the feudal era."

"But you're better than that! You're studly and could kick half the school's ass, probably three fourths at any other school!"

"No, I am a disgrace... For generations my family's men were able to fund their size due to a sizable pool of wealth. I am the first of my line too poor to grow to a reasonable size..." Kiyotaka put a hand on his stomach and sighed.

"So you're saying you wanna get fat? Isn't it better to be in shape?"

"Nonsense! Do you know nothing of tradition? And there are plenty of ways to be fatter and healthy. I would never sacrifice my muscle for fat, otherwise the fat would be more harmful to my body! None of my ancestors have let that happen and neither would I... not that it matters. Fat requires excess calories and excess calories require excess food, something my family lacks..." The look on Kiyotaka's face was unfamiliar to Mondo. It was despair. Helplessness. His bro was confronted with a problem he did not believe he could overcome.

Mondo couldn't let his bro be in that dark of a place. "Ya know what? If you wanna get big so bad then I might as well help you!"

Kiyotaka looked up. "Are you sure? You'd do that for me? How?"

"I dunno, you need good grub, I can help ya get it! I'll help ya get good and fat! Even if it's kinda weird..." Mondo gave Kiyotaka a thumbs up. Kiyotaka threw his arms around Mondo in an embrace.

"Thank you so much! Thank you!" He started crying again. "Thank you..." Mondo just returned the hug. He enjoyed these moments where he could experience affection, pure human contact, away from prying eyes. As stupid as it sounded, Mondo felt safe with Kiyotaka in his arms, like the world's problems were tiny. He'd do anything for his bro and he was sure the feeling were mutual, so long as that "anything" abides by the rules. After a minute or so, Kiyotaka broke the hug. "So when do we start?"

1141312.content:
Lunchtime at Kibogamine Academy. Mondo once again found himself waiting outside the doors to the cafeteria, collecting "kind gifts" from the students "lucky" enough to be under his gaze. Of course, anyone who were to question the rough and tough biker would have pointed out that he did not appear to need any more lunch money. After all, he carried two lunch bags with him...

Kiyotaka bounded around the corner, smiling at Mondo. Mondo could have sworn it was the fastest he had ever seen the kid move in the halls. It wasn't running though. Never run in the halls. Never.

"It is good to see you, bro! Are you ready to help be grow plump?" Kiyotaka said out loud.

Mondo just as loudly shushed him. "Bro, don't talk about that stuff out loud! People will think it's weird..."

Kiyotaka cocked his head. "I do not understand. What is there to judge?"

Mondo was perplexed. He was perplexed that Kiyotaka was perplexed. "Uh, don't you know that most people kinda avoid... ya know... fat? Of all kinds? Just cuz you and your family thinks it's good doesn't mean everyone does."

Kiyotaka sighed and looked down, smirking. "Oh, brother... I am flattered that you show concern for me, but any judgement that could be sent my way could only come from those too immature to accept differences! Sticks and stones, brother."

Mondo grabbed Kiyotaka by the collar. "HEY, I COULD GET IT ROUGH FOR THIS TOO, YA KNOW?!?" A few students turned their heads.

Kiyotaka simply put his hand on Mondo's face and lightly pushed him away. "If you're so concerned you do not have to help me."

Mondo took a deep breath and relaxed. "No, no. I'll be honest, I don't really get this whole "family tradition" stuff but it means a lot to ya... So if it's important to you it's important to me. Now come on, I picked you up a little something!" he said, gesturing to one of his lunch bags. The two boys walked into the lunchroom and resumed their previous seats. Hifumi slid his soda out of Mondo's reach in case he wanted to splash him again.

Mondo pulled his own regular lunch out of his bag. Kiyotaka did the same, giving a nervous look to Mondo. It was the same dry, low calorie morsel as yesterday and the day before. Mondo just looked at him. "Well? Eat up!" Kiyotaka nodded and dug in with determination. It wasn't much so by the time Mondo was half done he had finished.

Kiyotaka sighed. "So what now?"

Mondo chuckled and dumped the contents of the second bag in front of Kiyotaka. Out fell a small pile of some kind of bar wrapped in plastic. The hall monitor picked one up and read the label out loud. "Healthy Choice Nourishment Bar. Energy rich meal substitute. What?"

"That's your ticket to getting bigger!" Mondo said, leaning in to quiet the conversation. "Those things are packed full of calories. Carbs, sugars, fats, proteins, vitamins, all of it. They're meant to replace full meals for really poor people that can't feed themselves or sick people or something. Too bad they always sell 'em for crack, damn fuckheads... Anyways, they practically give them away in some of the run down neighborhoods my boys are from, so I had them pick me up some. Hell, they were happy to get them off their hands. Complaining they were gonna get fat n' shit. So it should work for you too! I've got some more in my locker and I can always get you more."

Kiyotaka flipped over the bar. "Serving size, one bar. Calories per serving... 600 calories?!?"

"They're not bad either. I tried one. Fills ya up fast though, so it'll be good training for pushing yourself to eat more. We'll work on that later tonight though."

"Tonight?"

"Yeah, we're going to that place on the corner near the park. You know, with the pet store?"

"The one with the baby husky you played with for an hour?"

Mondo blushed and slammed his fist on the table. "W-well he was a tough little guy! And it wasn't an hour! Anyways, we'll meet there at six thirty. That gives you time for studying so don't get your panties in a bunch about that. Until then, snack on those things."

"I will! Thank you for this gift!" Kiyotaka beamed up at Mondo. "And I will see you there!"

Kiyotaka checked his watch as he waited outside of the restaurant at he agreed to meet Mondo at. 6:32. Mondo was late. Kiyotaka was used to this by now, but it still unnerved him. He looked up and heard a screeching sound as a motorcycle wove between some cars and spun into the parking lot. Mondo stepped off and headed towards Taka, who after angrily lecturing him on proper safety and the importance of using helmets, joined him inside.

The restaurant Mondo picked wasn't anything fancy. Cheap was good, he explained, because you can get more on a budget. Also this place had some classic American greasy foods like pizza, burgers and such. "Bro, are you sure this is the best place? I could get a stain on my uniform..." Kiyotaka said.

"Yeah, I thought you'd say that, so I got you this." Mondo pulled out a black t-shirt made of a stretchy material. "Now before you say anything about accessorizing or representing your school and learning and stuff, hear me out." Kiyotaka pouted at the idea but let Mondo continue. "Black doesn't stain easily so you don't have to worry 'bout that. It's stretchy so if you get all bloated it won't get too tight. Your uniform's got all those buttons and it'd be a pain in the ass to work with those if you get too full. Also, you'll look hot for the babes!" Mondo grinned.

Taka snatched the shirt out of Mondo's hand. "You know the latter of that means little to me, but I'll wear it... For practicality's sake." He walked off to the bathroom to change. Meanwhile Mondo ordered a large pizza and a cheeseburger with two large and one medium drinks. The service was fast so by the time Kiyotaka has unbuttoned his shirt, removed it, rebuttoned it, folded it and put on the shirt Mondo got for him, the food was already there.

Kiyotaka glanced around nervously as he peeked out of the bathroom door. There weren't many people there, but he felt embarrassed. It was like one of those dreams where you're naked in public. He took a deep breath and strode down to the booth Mondo picked out for him. Two girls giggled as he passed by. He wanted to die. This was SO not appropriate.

He slid into the seat across from Mondo. "See, bro? It looks fine on ya! The girls over there love it too!" Mondo wasn't wrong. The shirt wasn't tight but it still showed off his muscle pretty well.
